column5: Again it was wonderful to see you guys again, my gals had a wonderful time helping out as well as I.  A special thank you goes out to Tyler, Elisa, Terry and family, big cliff , pikeslayer and friend, and many more gents.  My Gals wanted to share this with everyone, and yes shes got her racoon as well
And the racoon included  As long as they are happy I dont care at all

You just know the little one would never let you live it down   . Nor would the crowd  Wifey also had a good time, and she did not follow the family habit of going through the ice (it's a genetic thing   ) It sure was frosty out there, with near to no visibility at times. Judy was afraid we'd get lost. So she never moved more than 2 feet from the hut  to stretch her legs. I was nice and toasty, but Judy was a bit chilled, not enough layers  It was nice to see some favourite faces, and Judy now has her own fishing rod. Oh Yeah. It was a tough bite for many. We only managed 20 perch in 4 hours. Jose and the munchkin did worse, but they were having fun watching movies and eating pizza.
We had warm pizza and hot meals from the buddy heater it has more then one use lol The movies came in handy as a great time killer for the munchkin
That's awesome Vince    Looks like the three of you had a wonderful time   Give your gals a great big hug for me
Im calling Jerraldo Rivera to see if Jimmy Hoffa is hiding behind that locked door with no knob set...  from the smiles on their faces i would say they had a great day....  cheers

Vince, it was nice to see you again and to work the BBQs with you and the girls, it is so nice to see young people getting involved with projects like this! Those are two very special young ladies you have there!
Good stuff, Vince. That wind was brutal, hope you all stayed warm.

I've been watching for a report and pictures, so far all I have found is one article in a the Barrie Examiner Fishing for Tyler  I know there were at least two news papers there and saw quite a few people taking pictures, hopfully we'll get a report and some pictures posted today. I expect numbers will be down this year but it would still be nice to know how we did.
